verb.description: Legally take (another's child) and bring it up as one's own.
examples: there are many people eager to adopt a baby

verb.description: Choose to take up or follow (an idea, method, or course of action)
examples: this approach has been adopted by many big banks

verb.description: Take on or assume (an attitude or position)

origin: Late 15th century: via French from Latin adoptare, from ad- to + optare choose.
